												Please note that I got this game very cheaply as part of a bundle.The game it set in 3 different hospitals (a series - though the graphics and mechanics are identical in each) with 4 'episodes' in each - in other words, 12 missions. They have tried to implement a story as a way of introducing each mission but this is actually one of the biggest let downs of the game. I'm a story fan but this is truly awful; the attempt at humor is terrible!That's not to say the game isn't funny - the diseases, the animations etc are all funny and well done but I think they should have just left it at that and removed the story element altogether.There's a lot wrong with the game. In each mission you have a scenario that you start with and a set of objectives to complete and you can spend your time re-arranging the hospital, improving the decor, training up the staff and getting things running well only to have it all reset at the start of the next mission. This is particularly jarring within a series where each episode is supposed to just be the next shift at the hospital. Still, once you get used to it you won't keep making that mistake again.There's also some annoyances such as not being able to properly rotate the screen when you get to the edge of the hospital which makes it difficult to place items in those corners. Also the information screens are sorely lacking - it would be nice to see the laziness rating of the staff on the staff summary screen rather than having to click on every individual staff member one by one. And where's the financial info? Absolutely no financial data on profits / expenses etc which is odd.But despite all of those negatives I'm actually going to give this game a thumbs up because in the end, I enjoyed playing it and it gave me about 12 hours of entertainment which is all that matters. However, I wouldn't pay full price for it. I would say that if you are looking specifically for a hospital game and can pick it up cheaply then do so but if you're looking for a sim / tycoon / management game in general and don't mind the genre then give it a miss as there are much better ones out there.

												I've heard good things about this game and really love management sims, so I played the Story mode to learn how to play the game and I have to say the mechanics are certainly one of the best features of this game. The writing of the story itself is pretty poor, but this game doesn't take itself seriously. The story is done by a scrolling text on the bottom of the screen which sometimes changes too quickly to read, and there is no voice acting in terms you'd expect. Instead they use a technique similar to Simlish so the game can be played in multiple languages. However, story mode is but a tutorial and the game seems well rounded in terms of mechanics and animation.There are several aspects to the game mechanics and running a successful hospital hinges on being able to provide enough staff and equipment to deal with the influx of patients without going into the red, as well as keeping everyone happy. Happiness is determined by how much decoration is placed and there were times where it felt more like "Interior Design Tycoon". It's fairly easy as management sims go, but still enjoyable.I especially enjoyed discovering new diseases and putting new systems in place to treat them. The diseases are shown on collectible cards which show info on examination and treatment procedures. They are collected by researching someone with an unknown disease.Overall this game is great if you're looking for a management sim.

Still retains the feel of a very highly customisable building experience [I know *I* have a bit of an obsession with layouts and colour schemes for laying out and organising these sorts of places, so any others of you who do too will be glad to know there's plenty of capability, considering this is still a fairly retro-ish game] Whilst I didn't go all out on exploring this aspect, I thought it was pretty cool that you can actually control/micromanage the staff and affect their inter-staff relations and actions, live!CONS: The camera angles at times are just INFURIATING! [e.g. when you need to pan down to the bottom of the aerial view 'map' of the hospital to be able to see where you can fit a new room, there are serious issues with being able to see to the edges. NB: This *can* sometimes be 'remedied' by rotating the camera around a few times - but that is only SOMETIMES!] Basically, if you are the kinda person to flip-tables and rage-quit over this sorta stuff, maybe it's best steering clear - for your own sanity ;P [personally, I soldiered on patiently...but it was still fairly painful at times :P] Depends on your humour: if you can't stand lame [meant to be self-affacing I think] jokes or cheesy parodying then maybe this isn't for you either! [I just kinda went with it, rolling my eyes to myself...by the end I actually produced a chuckle now and then...what has happened to me?!? hahlp.] And of course, the graphics are very dated and the character models/animation a bit awkward...but hey, that's to be expected right? Some could criticise it for being "just a Theme Hospital clone", and to be honest, it kinda is. [But what's wrong with that, when it's also ADDING to the previous style with some of the fun new bits and bobs mentioned above?]Overall, I picked this up for something like 89p if I remember correctly... And I *certainly* got well over 89p's-worth of value out of it! It was possible to sink a good few hours into this game and thoroughly enjoy the experience.Pick yourself up a copy next time it's on sale, and surprise yourself with how much you can actually still enjoy a game that's pretty rough around the edges in places, a bit silly, but just downright fun :)!
